Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; de; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101206 Ubuntu/10.10 (maverick) Firefox/3.6.13

A typical use of the favicon is to drag it to the toolbar and drop it as a bookmark. If hovering the mouse pointer above the icon would trigger a tooltip to be shown (as for example the notice that the page does not verify its identity), it will also pop up while you drag the icon.
This is unfortunate, as the tooltip tends to hide parts of the toolbar underneath. If you use folders in the toolbar to organise bookmarks, some of the top level folders might disappear completely under the tooltip, making it impossible to move the icon to an appropriate position inside one of these folders.

Reproducible: Always



Expected Results:  
Tooltip popups should be restricted to hover situations.

Typical Ubuntu setup with Gnome 2.32/GTK 2.20/Metacity 2.30.2 and a theme that uses Murrine v0.91 GTK engine
comments.creator: ccprog@gmx.de
